Drider Venom.name: 蛛化精灵毒 Drider Venom
Drider Venom.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:28]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d8[poison]]伤害和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1}

Ziondriel.name: 齐昂德莉尔 Ziondriel
Ziondriel.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值
Ziondriel.publicNotes:
卓尔精灵所掌握的首个畸肉仪式仍然是他们最成功的且最臭名昭著的作品：蛛化精灵。卓尔精灵的身体与巨大蜘蛛相融，化身而成的蛛化精灵是具有两性差异的畸肉体——已知畸肉体中唯一能生育后代的存在。尽管雌性蛛化精灵有着卓尔女性那优雅的上身躯干，仅仅口中生有带毒的锋利尖牙而已，然而雄性蛛化精灵则长着进一步将蜘蛛与类人形态融合的丑陋、变异的面孔；这种外貌上的差异也许也反映了卓尔精灵那母系社会的性质。而在战斗中，所有蛛化精灵都一样充满危险性。

尽管畸肉仪式的最初是用于惩罚那些堕落的卓尔精灵，但这种可怖转化带来的巨大力量与优势对部分卓尔精灵也极具吸引力，在卓尔城市中有越来越多的低级公民自愿承受这痛苦的过程。这些自愿变化为蛛化精灵的个体会被强制性赋予士兵、守卫或者其他公职来作为参加仪式的回报（这一过程通常会持续数十年），并在之后允许过上自己的生活，通常是居住在城市外围的洞穴中。然而惨痛的现实是，对于大多数蛛化精灵来说，他们没有足够长的寿命来领取这一奖励，因为卓尔精灵喜欢把这些畸肉奴隶使唤到死，或者把他们部署到几乎无法存活的致命战争任务中去。

大多数蛛化精灵使用奥术，但众所周知的是蛛化精灵也能使用神术，只有极罕见的少数存在会使用异能或原能法术。无论其蛛化精灵的根源为何，其内在法术总是与之相同，但那些准备法术时使用完全不同种类法术的蛛化精灵则可能会有与后述数据完全不同的法术。

有些生物，并不满足于单纯杀死他们的敌人，这点在卓尔精灵身上尤为明显。他们沉迷于通过一种被称作畸肉仪式（fleshwarping）的骇人转化技术来彻底退化敌人。尽管畸肉仪式的流程并非卓尔精灵原创，但很多人认为是他们将其改良了。卓尔精灵把敌人扔进翻腾着魔法试剂的大桶里加以折磨，将其血肉与灵魂塑造成怪异畸形的物体。肉体的重塑产生了无数不同的畸肉体，后文列出的只是这些可怖造物中的几个例子。

Tail Lash.description:
触发 一个位于龙的尾击触及范围内的生物将使用一个动作进行打击或者尝试一次技能检定

效果 龙使用它的尾击打击触发的生物，它在此次打击中需承受-2减值。如果命中，则该生物在触发效果的投掷中承受-2环境减值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]
Tail Lash.name: 尾扫 Tail Lash

Breath Weapon.name: 吐息武器 Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description: 疤角会喷出一束酸液，在@Template[line|distance:80]范围内造成@Damage[15d6[acid]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。在接下来的[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4轮}内，她无法再次使用吐息武器。

Corrupt Water.name: 腐蚀之水 Corrupt Water
Corrupt Water.description:
频率 每天一次

效果 龙永久性地污染了90尺范围内总计10立方英尺的液体。这些水变得无法饮用，并且也无法让生命在里面进行水下呼吸。

如果液态的魔法物品或炼金物品的等级低于龙的生物等级，那么这些物品也将会被摧毁（一个生物可以尝试一次@Check[will|dc:31]检定来保护其所携带的液体）。该效果不会影响生物体内的液体。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪击打击和一次角抵打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当龙在一次打击中造成重击时，它立刻为吐息武器充能。

Scarhorn.name: 疤角 Scarhorn
Scarhorn.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Site Bound.name: 束缚之地 Site Bound
Site Bound.description: 典型的灵魂通常只能距离在他被杀死或作祟的地点很近的区域逗留。这个限制一般为120尺远。部分幽灵会被限制在对他来说具有特殊意义的房间、建筑、物品或生物上，而非具体的某个地点。

Rejuvenation.name: 复生 Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
完成幽灵的心愿能让它安息前往来世。

当幽灵被摧毁时，它会在[[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4日}后在被束缚的地点重新成型，被完全治愈。只有在任何阻止幽灵安息的因素都被纠正时，幽灵才能被永久摧毁。

Frightful Moan.name: 骇人悲叹 Frightful Moan
Frightful Moan.description: 幽灵为自身的命运而哀悼，迫使@Template[emanation|distance:30]{30尺}内的每个活物尝试一次@Check[will|dc:29|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened]豁免。豁免失败时，该生物会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}（大失败则为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}）。豁免成功时，该生物会在1分钟内临时免疫幽灵的骇人悲叹。

Telekinetic Assault.name: 念力袭击 Telekinetic Assault
Telekinetic Assault.description: 幽灵痛苦地尖啸并使得小物体和物体碎片在@Template[emanation|distance:30]区域内迸发飞溅。此区域内的生物会受到@Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害，具有@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect]豁免。

Skulls of Fear and Flame.name: 恐惧与火焰之骷髅头 Skulls of Fear and Flame
Skulls of Fear and Flame.disable: @Check[stealth|dc:27]以不被骷髅头察觉的方式穿过房间（这不会解除陷阱，但会阻止陷阱被触发）。@Check[thievery|dc:27]，连续三次，通过灵巧地从眼眶内侧刮去隐藏的符文来“致盲”相邻的一个骷髅头。@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]（4环级，反制DC25）来反制陷阱。
Skulls of Fear and Flame.hazarddescription: 一排骷髅头整齐地摆放在地面上，每个骷髅头上都插着黑色的蜡烛，它们利用黑暗视觉来察觉入侵者。地图上的红色箭头指示了骷髅头所朝向的方向。
Skulls of Fear and Flame.routine: （6动作）在陷阱的回合中，它首先使用一个动作将那些无法看到目标的骷髅头旋转360度，直到骷髅头发现目标为止。它会重复这个动作，直到所有六个骷髅头都在盯着目标，然后使用剩余的动作从它们的眼睛中射出火焰光束。陷阱每轮只能瞄准一个生物，因此如果目标数量少于动作数量，陷阱将失去任何额外的动作。每摧毁一个骷髅头，陷阱就会失去一个动作。
Skulls of Fear and Flame.reset: 如果没有可见的目标，陷阱会在其回合结束时停止运作，然后自动重置。
Skulls of Fear and Flame.stealthdetails: （专家）才能注意到骷髅头上未点燃的蜡烛上开始冒出袅袅细烟。

Fearful Cry.name: 恐惧嚎泣 Fearful Cry
Fearful Cry.description:
触发 当有生物走进骷髅头的视线范围内并被它们发现时

效果 所有六个骷髅头顶上的蜡烛突然点燃，骷髅头发出可怕而令人心智麻木的嚎叫。所有在区域F6、阶梯或东部沟槽内的生物都必须进行一次@Check[will|dc:25]豁免检定。之后，陷阱开始投掷先攻。

大成功 生物不受影响

成功 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}

失败生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}且在处于惊惧时一直@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]

大失败 同失败，但一旦生物不再惊惧，它之前一分钟内的记忆会被抹去——这很可能导致它忘记区域E7a阶梯顶部的暗门，只会留下一些奇怪的、挥之不去的对返回该区域的恐惧感。

Corpselight Mist.name: 尸光迷雾 Corpselight Mist
Corpselight Mist.disable: @Check[religion|dc:28]来向任意非邪恶神祗祈祷以反制卡布里里的影响使迷雾消散；或者@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]（3环环，反制DC23）来反制迷雾24小时。
Corpselight Mist.hazarddescription: 翻涌的绿光迷雾充斥着一条30尺深的裂隙。
Corpselight Mist.reset: 该危害在回合结束时自动重置，并可在下一轮再次触发。

Decay Flesh.name: 腐蚀肉体 Decay Flesh
Decay Flesh.description:
触发 一个生物在迷雾中结束回合

效果 迷雾会迅速腐蚀坑洞中所有生物的肉体，造成@Damage[10d6[void]]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:27|basic]强韧豁免检定）。

Communal Healing Hands.name: 共用治疗之手 Communal Healing Hands
Communal Healing Hands.description: 当阿布斯塔拉施放@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]时，他投掷d10而不是d8。当他施放治疗术为除自己以外的单个生物治疗时，他恢复等于治疗术环级的生命值。

Abstalar Zantus.name: 阿布斯塔拉·赞图斯 Abstalar Zantus

equipment-Pouch of Black Onyx.name: 一袋黑玛瑙 Pouch of Black Onyx

equipment-Incense and Offerings for Plan.name: 异界盟友用的焚香和贡物 Incense and Offerings for Planar Ally

Infused Items.name: 灌注物品 Infused Items
Infused Items.description: 坎克随身携带以下灌注物品，这些物品可持续效力24小时或直到他下一次进行每日准备：8瓶@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.jC8GmH0Un6vDxdMj]，8瓶@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.n5yTlTs63o53n3k6]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Cc4SokzVBoBCkHId]，2瓶@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.t4X6GDybqLmt7UkN]，5瓶@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.EX8Ta6J56SNrYbqJ]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.04giYigfDL5geu5f]，5瓶@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Wjkw0lEUOhypYvzo]，8个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.dsMkvuLgpOOGLWDy]。

Stench.description:
10尺。若有生物进入灵光范围或者在回合开始时位于灵光范围内，则必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:16]豁免，失败则会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（若为大失败，则只要处于恶心状态就还会附加@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}）。

身处灵光之内时，生物在对抗疾病以及从恶心状态中恢复的豁免检定中会承受-2环境减值。成功豁免的生物会获得1分钟的临时免疫。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]
Stench.name: 恶臭 Stench

Quick Bomber.description: 坎克使用交互动作取出一枚炼金炸弹，并投掷它进行一次远程打击。
Quick Bomber.name: 高速投弹手 Quick Bomber

Swift Leap.name: 迅捷跳跃 Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: 妖鬼能跳跃至多自身速度一半的距离。这次移动不会触发反应动作。

Toxic Effluvium.name: 毒液散放 Toxic Effluvium
Toxic Effluvium.description: 多年来，坎克接触了大量的毒素和毒药，这些毒素和毒药已经渗入了他的不死之身。当他使用毒液散放时，这些恶臭的液体会从他的肉体中渗出，使他的颚部和爪子分泌出垂涎流下的腥臭绿色毒液，这些毒液会包裹他的牙齿和利爪，以及他挥舞的任何武器。在他的下一回合开始前，坎克的近战打击会造成额外的2d6毒素伤害。

Evasion.name: 反射闪避 Evasion
Evasion.description: 当坎克在反射豁免检定上骰出成功时，取而代之获得大成功效果。

Consume Flesh.name: 啃食尸体 Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
需求 妖鬼与刚死亡1小时内的生物尸体相邻。

效果 妖鬼吞食一大块尸体并恢复@Damage[7d6[healing]]生命值。

妖鬼从每具尸体上只能获取一次生命值恢复。

如果坎克在实验室北侧凹室（区域J12）附近，他可以从那里的血槽里啃食尸体。

Expanded Splash.name: 溅射扩展 Expanded Splash
Expanded Splash.description: 当坎克投掷炸弹时，他可以最大限度地发挥炸弹的爆炸潜能，使炸弹造成不同于寻常溅射伤害的7点溅射伤害，并且溅射伤害会影响目标周围10尺范围内的所有生物。

Ghast Fever.name: 妖鬼热 Ghast Fever
Ghast Fever.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

阶段1 携带病原但没有不良效果（1天）

阶段2 @Damage[3d8[void]]伤害且从任何治疗获得的生命值恢复均减半（1天）

阶段3 如阶段2（1天）

阶段4 @Damage[3d8[void]]伤害且无法从治疗获得任何好处（1天）

阶段5 如阶段4（1天）

阶段6 死亡，并在下一日的午夜作为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]复生。

Paralysis.name: 麻痹 Paralysis
Paralysis.description: 任意活着的生物在受到妖鬼的攻击时必须成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:32]豁免，失败则会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]。被麻痹的生物可以在自己的每个回合结束时尝试一次新的豁免，每次此豁免的DC都会递减1点。

Fires of Abraxas.name: 阿巴拉克萨斯之火 Fires of Abraxas
Fires of Abraxas.disable:
@Check[thievery|dc:23]检定以破坏墙上的小型触发符文中的一个，或者通过@Check[religion|dc:23]检定以向一位善良神祗祈祷来压制陷阱

避免触发 墙壁上用瑟西隆语刻着对阿巴拉克萨斯的祈祷，说出其中一个祈祷会使陷阱失效1小时。
Fires of Abraxas.hazarddescription: 除非用瑟西隆语向阿巴拉克萨斯祈祷，否则火柱会从七芒秘印内的火焰中喷射出来，席卷整个房间。

Fiery Beam.name: 凶猛光束 Fiery Beam
Fiery Beam.description:
触发 当通往区域B3的门打开或损坏时。

效果 两根火焰光束从西面和北面的七芒秘印中射出，然后扫过房间。区域B2的所有生物都会受到@Damage[6d10[fire]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic]豁免）。

Narlo Nyrell.publicNotes:
当一位牧师背叛了他的神明并在渎神之怒的控制下死去时，他们在生前犯下的亵渎之罪会促使他们转变成不死生物叛教尸。叛教尸们试图向他们曾经崇拜的神复仇，玷污庙宇，杀死信徒，聚集次级不死生物和崇拜死亡的邪教徒来协助它们进行不洁的任务。虽然叛教尸的神赐能力大部分都被腐化为卑劣的不死形态，但它们仍然顽固地依靠着它们先前力量的残余，仍然施展并挥舞着他们如此鄙视的神所青睐的魔法和武器。

一群亵渎了同一个神祇的叛教尸有时会联合起来组成一个以嘲弄为目的圣会，以近乎狂喜的方式进行亵渎仪式。这些圣会通常是由一个亵渎神明的邪教中的成员们组成，他们生前一起践行他们的异端邪说，并一同赴死。但也有一些是由先前的信仰相同的落单叛教尸聚集到了一起所组成。

Final Blasphemy.name: 最后的亵渎 Final Blasphemy
Final Blasphemy.description:
当叛教尸被摧毁时，它爆裂成一股虚能，效果等同于3动作版的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]（@Check[fortitude|dc:18]）。

因叛教尸已被摧毁，所以它不会从这个伤害术的效果中获得任何生命值，也不需要保有任何可用的伤害术来发动该技能。

Swarming Curse.name: 集群诅咒 Swarming Curse
Swarming Curse.description: 成百上千的叮咬飞蝇在纳尔洛的骨骼上爬行，几乎填满了他的盔甲，就像他曾经的血肉一样。当这些飞蝇被火焰焚烧时，纳尔洛也会受到伤害，并因此获得对火焰的5点弱点。每当纳尔洛施放法术时，这些飞蝇便会从他的体内爆发出来，在他周围形成一个@Template[emanation|distance:10]范围的嗡嗡作响、不断叮咬的云雾，这种状态会一直持续到他的下一个回合开始。在这段时间里，他失去了对火焰的弱点，而任何在其回合结束时位于该范围内的生物，都会受到@Damage[4d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect]豁免），这是由叮咬的飞蝇群造成的。

Narlo Nyrell.name: 纳尔洛·奈瑞尔 Narlo Nyrell

prototypeToken.name: 卡勒布·瓦尔德玛的身体

Kaleb Valdemar's Body.name: 卡勒布·瓦尔德玛的身体 Kaleb Valdemar's Body
Kaleb Valdemar's Body.publicNotes: 噬智怪是被称作黑色支配者的强大外星势力的先行侦察兵和渗透者。这些怪物游荡在幽暗之地（Darklands），从此处秘密入侵着地表世界。当一只噬智怪渗透进某个社群，它的首要目标是获取一具身体。它或许会优先去墓地寻找一具新鲜的尸体，这比通过战斗再杀死某人要容易。当异怪将自己挤进宿主的颅腔内，它的真身就会感知迟钝，因为它会连接到宿主的神经系统中。如果被发现，噬智怪就会快速占据一具新的身躯来让自己逃脱，最好是某些不显眼的生物，例如家畜。

Fiendish Flock.publicNotes:
群聚的渡鸦本来就以刻薄无情而为人所知，而这种色彩在一帮渡鸦决定分工协作的时候就更为浓重了。在大多数情况下，乌鸦群不会攻击更大的敌人，但当它们被超自然力量或因为饥饿导致的绝望操纵时，无情的鸦群会成为致命的敌人。

很少有群居的鸟类像渡鸦那样狡猾。

Beaks and Talons.name: 尖喙与利爪 Beaks and Talons
Beaks and Talons.description: 魔化鸟群愤怒地用喙啄击和用爪撕扯，对集群空间内的每个敌人造成@Damage[2d6[piercing],2d6[slashing]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic]豁免）。若某生物豁免大失败，则会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2][[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}，因为飞鸟们会集中攻击该生物的脸部。

Fiendish Flock.name: 魔化鸟群 Fiendish Flock

Statue of Alaznist.name: 阿拉兹尼斯特雕像 Statue of Alaznist

Construct Armor (Hardness 7).name: 构装护甲（硬度7） Construct Armor (Hardness 7)
Construct Armor (Hardness 7).description:
与普通的物体一样，活化雕像同样拥有硬度。硬度可以减少其所受到的任何伤害，其数值等同于硬度的数值。

一旦活化雕像的生命值降低至一半以下，或是受到重击伤害后，其构装护甲将会破损，其AC降低至15。

Statue of Alaznist.publicNotes:
活化雕像通常都被用于守护墓穴、小型神庙、或是政府大楼中的某些区域，它们通常都会混杂在其他普通雕像之中，借此隐藏它们作为活化生物的特性，直到它们因为入侵者而被激怒。许多不那么谨慎的妄想雕像会活化并发动攻击的冒险者，会砸碎他们所遇到的一切雕像，从而使得那些无害的古老的文物惨遭破坏。

通过某些仪式或是其他怪异的魔法，活物物体有着诸多形态和多种用途。这类生物中有很大一部分都被作为守卫，对那些毫无戒心的冒险者发起突然袭击。剩下的则是作为土豪们的玩物，被用于处理一些零活，诸如此类。

False Devil.name: 冒牌魔鬼 False Devil
False Devil.publicNotes:
这些恶名昭著的掠食者对鲜血有着极端的渴望。卓柏卡布拉偏爱捕食弱小而缓慢的猎物，它们在捕食前往往会藏起来观察猎物很长时间。卓柏卡布拉灵活而又隐秘，喜欢待在草丛茂盛或岩石密布的地方，它们微微反光的鳞片可以让它们很好地融入这种环境。

卓柏卡布拉偏好袭击落单的旅人和家畜（特别是山羊），除了那些被吸干血液的猎物残余的恐怖而又鲜血淋漓的皮囊外，它们几乎不会留下任何曾经出现过的痕迹。它们倾向于远离人们的视线，再加上其夜行的天性，往往会使得迷信的当地人得出最糟糕的结论，想象着有一个特别鲁莽的吸血鬼生活在这个地区。

一只典型的卓柏卡布拉从口部到带刺的尾巴尖有近4尺长，站立时高不到3.5尺。它们体态轻盈，骨头轻巧，体重大约50磅。它们极少、并且仅在最为炎热的月份里才会进行交配，每只雌性会生下一个蛋，并孵化出一个羸弱、脱水的生物。母亲通常会把一只无助的猎物留在洞穴里，让幼崽立刻就能进食。

尽管卓柏卡布拉是典型的独行生物，但在猎物丰富的地方它们也会组成小群行动。这些小队协作良好，变得足够大胆去攻击大群的动物、小型兽群、或者其他更危险的猎物。那些关于卓柏卡布拉袭击旅人或者围攻农庄的故事，大多数都来源于这些群体的狩猎行为。在卓柏卡布拉活动更为常见的地区，通常会有复杂多彩的传说与怪谈诉说着它们的能力和机动性——并且其中的一些传言，例如会飞的卓柏卡布拉，都是千真万确的。

Chupar.name: 吸血 Suck Blood
Chupar.description:
需求 一个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于卓柏卡布拉

效果 卓柏卡布拉从受擒的生物上吸血。卓柏卡布拉获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]状态，持续1分钟，并且只能使用该额外动作来执行打击和行走动作。当卓柏卡布拉因此法获得迅捷状态时便不能再次使用吸血。

被卓柏卡布拉吸血的生物将获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}，直到其接受了治疗（任意种类或数值）。

Pounce.description: 卓柏卡布拉行走，并且在此次移动结束时进行一次打击，如果卓柏卡布拉在此动作开始时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]状态，那么在完成此能力的打击之前都其保持藏匿状态。
Pounce.name: 猛扑 Pounce

Wing Flurry.name: 翅膀狂舞 Wing Flurry
Wing Flurry.description: 冒牌魔鬼带刺的翅膀并不具备典型的近战攻击能力，但它可以用刺翼对飞过的敌人进行刮蹭和劈砍。长着翅膀的卓柏卡布拉会尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]穿过敌人的空间。当它这样做时，它会猛烈地扇动翅膀，并在其特技检定中获得+2环境加值。如果成功，它会对被翻滚越过的生物造成@Damage[4d6[slashing]]伤害（或在大成功时造成@Damage[8d6[slashing]]伤害）。

Glorkus.name: Glorkus

Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[3d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.
Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Glorkus.publicNotes:
Ghouls are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.
Glorkus.blurb: Male goblin ghoul cleric of Kabriri

Rejuvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.
Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation

Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
Sacrilegious Aura.description: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+13 #Counteract]]{+13}.

Devastating Blast.name: Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description:
The graveknight unleashes a @Template[cone|distance:30] of energy. Creatures in the area take @Damage[4d12[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

Dogslicer Cruelty.name: Dogslicer Cruelty
Dogslicer Cruelty.description: On a critical hit with a dogslicer, Ripnugget yanks bits of flesh from his victim as he rips the blade free. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} from the pain, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} as long as they remain sickened.

Phantom Mount.description:
Ripnugget's mount is a giant gecko (HP 37; AC 19, Fort +11, Ref +8, Will +7) named Stickfoot.

The graveknight summons a supernatural mount as per @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Marvelous Mount}, heightened to a level equal to half the graveknight's level.

Unlike phantom steed, the steed's AC and saving throw bonuses are all 4 lower than the graveknight's, and the steed has one-third the graveknight's Hit Points (rounded down).

If the steed is destroyed, the graveknight must wait 1 hour before using this ability again.
Phantom Mount.name: Phantom Mount

Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
Weapon Master.description: The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.

Graveknight's Curse.name: Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:24] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, the creature's Speed is reduced by 10, and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.6rnB7nK6J6zF4vea]{Effect: Graveknight's Curse}

Ripnugget.name: Ripnugget
Ripnugget.publicNotes: Graveknights are undead warriors granted unlife by a cursed suit of armor.

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description: Tunch carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)} (8), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ktjFOp3U0wQD9t0Z]{Antidote (Lesser)} (2), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)} (4), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.evBPzM1VsuYcoenn]{Glue Bomb (Moderate)} (2)

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: Tunch Interacts to draw a bomb, then Strikes with it.

Goblin Scuttle.name: 地精快步 Goblin Scuttle
Goblin Scuttle.description:
触发 一个地精盟友在与该地精相邻的位置结束其移动动作

效果 该地精@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]。

Calculated Splash.name: Calculated Splash
Calculated Splash.description: When Tunch throws a bomb with the splash trait, it deals splash damage equal to his Intelligence modifier.

Distracting Whistle.name: Distracting Whistle
Distracting Whistle.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Tunch whistles in a way that causes the sound to manifest elsewhere, potentially distracting a foe. One target of Tunch's choice that he can see within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of Tunch's next turn by the distracting whistling sound that seems to come from behind them. The target is then temporarily immune to Distracting Whistle for 1 hour.

Zoog Swarm.name: Zoog Swarm
Zoog Swarm.publicNotes:
If a family of zoogs avoids infighting and locates a reliable enough food source, their numbers can swell into truly massive swarms.

Furry, tentacle-snouted, and prone to chittering, zoogs dwell in the shadowy parts of the world where dreams have an uncanny knack for coming true. They typically gather in small families, and while zoogs normally eat fungi and plants, some have developed a taste for sentient beings.

Zoogs Vs. Cats

Zoogs and cats have a storied hatred, though neither side can remember the original cause. Zoogs have been known to prey on kittens, but their courage fails quickly when confronted by a full-grown cat. Cats, on the other hand, are always quick to pounce, chase, and attack zoogs on sight.

Spell Sight.name: Spell Sight
Spell Sight.description: A zoog's eyes shed bright light in a @Template[emanation|distance:15] (and dim light in the next 15 feet). Any magic effect in this area glows faintly. A zoog can quell or renew this light as a free action on its turn.

Gnash and Slash.name: Gnash and Slash
Gnash and Slash.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d6[piercing],2d6[slashing]]{2d6 piercing damage, 2d6 slashing damage}, and @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save). A successful save negates the bleed damage. The slashing damage can damage incorporeal creatures, as if it were enhanced by a ghost touch property rune.

Overwhelming Clutches.name: Overwhelming Clutches
Overwhelming Clutches.description: The zoog swarm attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a Medium or smaller creature in its space. If the swarm Grabs or Restrains the creature, the zoog swarm can then Stride twice, dragging the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} creature along with them as they move.

Charn Scarnetti.name: Charn Scarnetti
Charn Scarnetti.publicNotes:
Envied by many and detested by still others, nobles exude confidence and gentility. Gossip and gambling are often nobles' favorite pastimes. Day-to-day life for a noble is often a mixture of business and leisure, and to an onlooker, such a lifestyle can appear to be nothing more than a string of meals, parties, and game halls. However, despite what some might believe, life as a noble is often quite dangerous and requires far more intellect than it would appear-along with a healthy dose of suspicion.

Though adventurers travel through perilous dungeons and across treacherous wilderness, sometimes the most dangerous place they can end up is in a noble court.

Lip Reader.name: Lip Reader
Lip Reader.description: After years of sticking their nose where it doesn't belong, the noble has learned to read lips from afar, with the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.yUuU9xyotrpwpTyC]{Read Lips} feat.

Noble's Ruse.name: Noble's Ruse
Noble's Ruse.description:
Frequency Once per round

Effect The noble @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}. On a success, the noble Strikes the target.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The noble deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Goblin Ghoul.name: Goblin Ghoul
Goblin Ghoul.publicNotes:
Ghouls are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:15]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
Swift Leap.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
If Jervis is destroyed, he rejuvenates back in the underground chambers below Chopper's Isle and seeks out the carrier of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.mnEj7ll9WffO8WLu]{Clockwork Songbird's} head as long as they remain within 5 miles of Sandpoint. If the architect of his whole doom, the Red Bishop, is slain, Stoot can move on to the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

Tears of Blood.name: Tears of Blood
Tears of Blood.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Jervis Stoot makes a plucking motion with his fingers. One creature he can sense within 30 feet experiences the agony of their eyes being plucked out and takes @Damage[12d6[mental]] damage from the pain (@Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic] save, plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute on a critical failure).

Avian Vulnerability.description: Jervis' resistance to all damage is additionally bypassed by Strikes from birds or avian creatures (including creatures who fly with wings, but not creatures who fly through magic alone)
Avian Vulnerability.name: Avian Vulnerability

Trinket Bound.name: Trinket Bound
Trinket Bound.description: Jervis Stoot can normally stray only a short distance from the underground chambers atop Chopper's Isle just north of Sandpoint, but when the head of the clockwork songbird is brought out of that area, Stoot can follow. As long as a creature he possesses carries the head, he can travel as he wishes, but no further than 5 miles from the town of Sandpoint.

Ghostly Murder.name: Ghostly Murder
Ghostly Murder.description:
Jervis Stoot raises a hand high, and a murder of ghostly crows manifests in a vortex above his hand. He then lowers his hand to point in a direction, and the murder of ghostly crows swarms out in a @Template[cone|distance:20]. All creatures caught in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:30|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save. Jervis can't use Ghostly Murder again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Ghostly Murder]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[6d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[10d6[slashing],2d6[bleed]|options:area-damage]{10d6 slashing damage and 2d6 bleed} damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[15d6[slashing],5d6[bleed]|options:area-damage]{15d6 slashing damage, 5d6 bleed} damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}. The blindness persists until it's healed via an effect like restore senses.

Malevolent Possession.name: Malevolent Possession
Malevolent Possession.description: The ghost attempts to possess an adjacent corporeal creature that carries the head of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.mnEj7ll9WffO8WLu]{Clockwork Songbird} somewhere on their person. This has the same effect as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell, except since the ghost doesn't have a physical body, it is unaffected by that restriction of the spell.

The Three Steps.name: The Three Steps
The Three Steps.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23] to trick the basket on the door handle into thinking it's got a proper bead inside it, or @Check[stealth|dc:18] each round to avoid being detected by the trap
The Three Steps.hazarddescription: Beams of magical energy fire from the Sihedrons to fan the room.

Wrathful Blast.name: Wrathful Blast
Wrathful Blast.description:
Trigger A creature ends its turn in the room.

Effect Beams of energy fan out of the Sihedrons on the east and west wall, causing 9d6 energy damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save) to all creatures in the room. The trap in area B4a deals @Damage[9d6[fire]] damage, the one in B4b @Damage[9d6[cold]] damage, and the one in B4c @Damage[9d6[poison]] damage.

Shadows of Everglut.hazarddescription: Swirling shadows that behave like animated pools of ink splash and slither up against the limbs of those who tread too far into this chamber.
Shadows of Everglut.routine: (1 action) The shadows writhing on the floor extrude a storm of inky tentacles of smoke and darkness that whip and writhe throughout the room, filling the air with unsettling sounds of agonizing cries and shrieks. All creatures in area J3a take @Damage[8d6[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic] save).
Shadows of Everglut.reset: The hazard settles back down 1 round after all creatures leave the room and can trigger again at the start of the next round.

Sap Strength.name: Sap Strength
Sap Strength.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the room beyond the northern stairs

Effect Shadowy tendrils wisp up from the darkness below to brush against the triggering creature's body. The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or their strength is sapped from their body. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature's speeds are reduced by 10 feet for 1 round.

Failure As success, but the creature also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Shadows of Everglut.name: Shadows of Everglut
Shadows of Everglut.disable: Three @Check[arcana|dc:33] or @Check[occultism|dc:33] checks to redirect the negative energy back in on itself and disrupt the hazard's source of power, a @Check[religion|dc:36] check to offer prayers to sever the sacred link to Kabriri, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (6th rank; counteract DC 29) to render the hazard inert for 10 minutes

Cruncher.name: Cruncher

Trackless.description: A hodag sweeps the ground behind it with its tail as it moves, obscuring its tracks. The DCs of checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} a hodag are increased by 10.
Trackless.name: Trackless

Rip and Tear.name: Rip and Tear
Rip and Tear.description: The hodag makes two claw Strikes and one jaws Strike in any order.

Sickly.name: Sickly
Sickly.description:
Cruncher is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} due to his mistreatment from the goblins. In addition, his eyes are rheumy and caked with gunk, resulting in a –4 circumstance penalty to sight-based Perception checks and causing him to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} beyond a range of 5 feet. If he escapes into the wild, he heals back up after a few nights' rest and a big meal. Alternatively, a PC can speed his recovery with a @Check[medicine|dc:20] check, with the results detailed below; this takes 10 minutes to perform, and as such Cruncher needs to either be helpless or willing to receive the attention.

Critical Success Cruncher's vision clears and he loses the enfeebled condition.

Success Cruncher's vision clears, and he'll lose the enfeebled condition after 8 hours of rest.

Failure The attempt provides no aid.

Critical Failure As failure, but Cruncher takes @Damage[2d6] points of damage as well, potentially causing him to lose his trust in the PCs and driving him to attack.

Toss.name: Toss
Toss.description:
The hodag Strides, then makes a Strike against a target in reach. If it moves at least 20 feet and succeeds at its Strike, the hodag deals damage normally and then attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC to toss the enemy into the air.

On a success, the tossed creature is thrown 10 feet in a straight line in the direction of the hodag's choice and then lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If the creature is knocked into a solid object, it takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage as well before landing prone. The hodag can instead toss a creature straight up in the air. The creature lands in the same square where it started, takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and lands prone.

Cruncher.publicNotes:
Because they are often described only in drunken retellings of loggers' or miners' tales, hodags are considered by many to exist only in the local folklore of remote areas. However, some individuals have actually encountered these dangerous beasts firsthand, and even fewer have lived to tell their tales.

Hodags are reptilian creatures the size of bulls. These vicious predators' long claws can tear creatures apart in seconds. Their backs sport dozens of long spines that run from their snouts all the way down the length of their powerful tails. Their wide mouths are full of sharp and twisted rows of teeth not unlike those of a shark. The hodags' rough, scaly hides carry hues of green and brown, allowing them to blend into their forest surroundings where they ambush prey. Only their glowing red eyes reveal their presence, though hodags have learned to use this to their advantage by drawing attention to their eyes in one area, then closing their eyes and stealthily moving to another area to cause their prey to misconstrue their location.

In the wintertime, when snow and ice blankets a region, hodags grow a foul-smelling coat of greasy, dark-brown fur that sprouts in tufts from between their scales. A typical hodag measures over 10 feet long from snout to tail and weighs upward of 700 pounds.

Giant Longlegs.publicNotes:
The most widespread of the longlegs is the giant longlegs, a creature with a body the size of a dog whose long, spindly legs give it a much more intimidating appearance.

While smaller specimens of these unsettling-looking arachnids (known regionally by names like harvesters, tickle spiders, or daddy longlegs) are harmless, their larger cousins, known simply as longlegs, are anything but.

Longlegs Species

Beyond the two common types presented here, many other variants of longlegs can be found throughout Golarion, with the exception of its arctic regions, where longlegs don't thrive. They often live on the periphery of cities, lurking in sewers or ruins where the hunting is good. Swarms of sewer longlegs are particularly dangerous and infest the undercities of many Taldan settlements, while to the west in Cheliax, the much-larger executor longlegs prefer to live among the rooflines of slums where Thrune's rule has been particularly horrific. Among the largest of all longlegs, though, is the dreaded (and thankfully rare) treeleg harvester of the Mwangi Expanse.

Cluster.name: Cluster
Cluster.description: A giant longlegs can share the same space as another giant longlegs, but no more than three giant longlegs can occupy the same space.

Bob.name: Bob
Bob.description: The giant longlegs begins to bob up and down, using its legs almost like springs to cause its body to bounce and sway in an unsettling manner. Until the start of the giant longlegs's next turn, it gains a +2 status bonus to its Armor Class.

Noxious Spray.name: Noxious Spray
Noxious Spray.description:
The giant longlegs sprays a noxious chemical onto a single adjacent target, who must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save. The giant longlegs can't use Noxious Spray for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune to Noxious Spray for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for as long as they remain sickened.

Giant Longlegs.name: Giant Longlegs

Spell Sight.description: A zoog's eyes shed bright light in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (and dim light in the next 15 feet). Any magic effect in this area glows faintly. A zoog can quell or renew this light as a free action on its turn.
Spell Sight.name: Spell Sight

Otherworldly Touch.name: Otherworldly Touch
Otherworldly Touch.description: A zoog's claw Strike can damage incorporeal creatures, as if they were enhanced by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune.

Zoog.name: Zoog
Zoog.publicNotes:
Furry, tentacle-snouted, and prone to chittering, zoogs dwell in the shadowy parts of the world where dreams have an uncanny knack for coming true. They typically gather in small families, and while zoogs normally eat fungi and plants, some have developed a taste for sentient beings.

Zoogs Vs. Cats

Zoogs and cats have a storied hatred, though neither side can remember the original cause. Zoogs have been known to prey on kittens, but their courage fails quickly when confronted by a full-grown cat. Cats, on the other hand, are always quick to pounce, chase, and attack zoogs on sight.

Reach Spell.name: Reach Spell
Reach Spell.description: If the next action Asmerelli takes is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet.

Devil's Cursed Breath.name: 魔鬼咒息 Devil's Cursed Breath
Devil's Cursed Breath.description:
频率 每天一次

效果 阿斯梅雷利咬伤自己的舌头（受到@Damage[1[slashing]]伤害），然后喷吐出@Template[cone|distance:15]的燃烧烟雾。该区域内的每个生物都必须尝试@Check[reflex|dc:26|options:area-effect,damaging-effect]豁免检定。

大成功 生物不受影响

成功 生物受到@Damage[3d8[fire]|options:area-damage]伤害

失败 生物受到@Damage[7d8[fire]|options:area-damage]伤害且由于烧伤的剧痛陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}

大失败 生物受到@Damage[10d8[fire]|options:area-damage]且由于烧伤的剧痛陷入恶心1，并受到诅咒，受害者的烧伤从未完全消失，而由于持续的疼痛，这个被诅咒的生物在所有攻击中都会受到-2的状态减值。治疗无法改变烧伤的外观或降低减值，但解除诅咒可以。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.khL2A1slsnufpJp4]

Greedspawn.name: Greedspawn
Greedspawn.publicNotes:
Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords-each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins. The first sinspawn was created by the Runelord of Wrath, utilizing techniques that have since gone on to influence fleshwarping practices. It wasn't long before the technique used to create sinspawn fell into the hands of the other runelords, and while each tried their own hand at crafting variants of their own design, today sinspawn of wrath remain the most numerous and notorious of their kind. Bearing only a vague resemblance to the humanoids from whose flesh they were formed, sinspawn generally appear horrifically emaciated and have unnaturally long arms and digitigrade legs, each with a trio of stubby, taloned digits. Veins bulge across sinspawn's bodies in sanguine patterns that suspiciously resemble twisted runes, and their flesh is pale and hairless. Their heads are elongated, bearing only slits for a nose, red eyes, and disturbing lower jaws that split in half at the chin, revealing pedipalps that end in tiny, three-fingered hands and framing a long, lolling tongue. Sinspawn stand 6-1/2 feet tall and typically weigh as much as an emaciated human of their size. They behave in a manner consistent with their associated sin and have physical characteristics that hint at these qualities. For example, greedspawn's veins appear to run with gold while envyspawn appear even more wasted than the rest of their kin.

Greedspawn are the tallest of sinspawn, often 7 feet in height, and with gold-tinged veins.
Greedspawn.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status to all saves vs. mental

Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
Sin Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin, as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Sinful Bite.name: Sinful Bite
Sinful Bite.description:
A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

Critical Success Unaffected

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}

Critical Failure sickened 2 plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 minute

Devil's Breath.name: Devil's Breath
Devil's Breath.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The Devil's Disciple cuts their tongue with a slashing weapon held in a hand (taking @Damage[1[slashing]] damage), then exhales a @Template[cone|distance:15] of burning smoke. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[1d8[fire]|options:area-damage] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[2d8[fire]|options:area-damage] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} by the agonizing pain of the burns.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d8[fire]|options:area-damage] damage, is sickened 1 by the agonizing pain of the burns, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} by the smoke for 1 minute.

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description:
24 hours, [[/act disable-device dc=26]]{DC 26 Thievery}, standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to Disable a Device to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.

Activate Serpent Mode.name: Activate Serpent Mode
Activate Serpent Mode.description:
Trigger The clockwork serpent begins its turn

Effect The clockwork serpent transforms into a different mode. Roll 1d3 and consult the options below. If it rolls a mode it can't currently activate, the clockwork serpent becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the start of its next turn. At the end of its turn, it automatically deactivates its serpent mode.

1 Cobra Mode The clockwork serpent can use Intimidating Hood.

2 Constrictor Mode The clockwork serpent can use its coils Strike and can Constrict.

3 Rattlesnake Mode The clockwork serpent can use Shattering Rattle.

Critical Deactivation.name: Critical Deactivation
Critical Deactivation.description: If a clockwork serpent takes any precision damage or takes a critical hit and it has a serpent mode active, it must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:16]. On a failure, it takes the damage from the critical hit as normal, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}, and its serpent mode deactivates.

Shattering Rattle.name: Shattering Rattle
Shattering Rattle.description:
Requirements The clockwork serpent is in rattlesnake mode

Effect The clockwork serpent rattles its tail, then snaps it like a whip to create a devastating blast of sonic energy in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[9d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Clockwork Serpent Venom.name: Clockwork Serpent Venom
Clockwork Serpent Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:26]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

Constrict.name: Constrict
Constrict.description:
@Damage[(2d10+6)[bludgeoning]], @Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic]

Requirements The clockwork serpent is in constrictor mode

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

Intimidating Hood.name: Intimidating Hood
Intimidating Hood.description:
Requirements The clockwork serpent is in cobra mode

Effect The clockwork serpent flares out a cobra hood. All creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:15] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Clockwork Serpent.name: Clockwork Serpent
Clockwork Serpent.publicNotes:
Clockwork serpents are often found serving as guardians in serpentfolk laboratories or temples.

Experimental Serpents

Even stranger clockwork serpents are rumored to exist in the heart of serpentfolk enclaves. These constructs supposedly can repair damage to themselves when they change serpent modes, activate additional forms that allow swimming or flight, or even break apart into a seething swarm of smaller clockwork serpents.

Pitchforks and Torches.name: Pitchforks and Torches
Pitchforks and Torches.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round.

Effect The angry townsfolk engage in a coordinated melee attack against each enemy within @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet}, with a @Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d10[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(1d10+7)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(1d10+10)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
Troop Movement.description:
Whenever the city guards Stride, they first @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.OvqohW9YuahnFaiX]{Form Up} as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then move up to their Speed.

This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the guards enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to all the guards.

Urban Chasers.name: Urban Chasers
Urban Chasers.description: Angry townsfolk ignore difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain) caused by crowds or from movement through narrow spaces such as alleyways.

Seek Quarry.name: Seek Quarry
Seek Quarry.description: Angry townsfolk can spend 1 minute to designate a single creature for whom they have a physical description as their quarry. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception against their quarry.

Toxic Crystals.name: Toxic Crystals
Toxic Crystals.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:30] (expert) to create a chain reaction among the crystals by striking them in precise spots that cause them to shatter and harmlessly discharge their energy, or @Check[performance|dc:27] (expert) to use a musical instrument or singing to resonate the crystals and discharge their toxic energy harmlessly
Toxic Crystals.hazarddescription: The green crystals begin to pulse more brightly with light in the presence of living creatures. These fluctuations in illumination from different crystals eerily match the pace of the breathing and rhythm of the heartbeats of those in the room.
Toxic Crystals.routine:
(1 action) (light, poison) Each round on their action, the toxic crystals emit a shrill humming sound and flash brightly with green light. All creatures in area E14 or within the first 10 feet of either passage leading out of this area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|traits:light,poison|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d8[poison]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d8[poison]] damage, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute.
Toxic Crystals.reset: The toxic crystals become dormant once no living creatures are in range, but can activate again as soon as another living creature comes in range.

Nauseating Pulse.name: Nauseating Pulse
Nauseating Pulse.description:
Trigger A living creature comes within 20 feet of the green crystals

Effect The crystals pulse with nauseating light. All creatures in area E14 or within the first 10 feet of either passage leading out of this area must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} on a critical failure).

Embed Hook.name: Embed Hook
Embed Hook.description:
Requirements Gorlak's previous action was a successful Strike on a creature with his ogre hook

Effect Gorlak twists his hook to embed it in the creature by attempting an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the target's Fortitude DC. On a success, that creature takes @Damage[(1d10+9)[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save) and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until Gorlak attempts another Strike with his Ogre Hook or attempts to Fling Foe the creature.

Fling Foe.name: Fling Foe
Fling Foe.description:
Requirements Gorlak's last action was to Embed Hook in a Medium or smaller creature

Effect Gorlak attempts to fling the creature embedded on his hook through the air by attempting an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the embedded creature's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success The creature takes @Damage[(2d10+9)[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save) as the hook rips free and is hurled 15 feet away, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in a space of Gorlak's choosing.

Success The creature takes @Damage[(1d10+9)[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save) as the hook rips free and is hurled 5 feet away, becoming prone.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[1d10[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save) as the hook rips free and is left standing in a space adjacent to Gorlak.

Critical Failure The creature takes no damage as the hook rips free. It is left standing in a space adjacent to Gorlak, and Gorlak becomes so frustrated by his failure that he must use his first action on his next turn to curse and scream and shake his fists in the air.

label: 沙尖七灾 Seven Dooms for Sandpoint Bestiary
